etymologies: Middle English: from Old French maquerel, of unknown origin

definitions: a migratory surface-dwelling predatory fish, commercially important as a food fish.

notes.text: Scomber and other genera, family Scombridae (the mackerel family): many species, in particular the North Atlantic mackerel (S. scombrus). The members of the mackerel family, which includes the tunas, are fast-moving marine predators and often popular as game fish

shortDefinitions: predatory marine fish with greenish-blue back, important as food fish
